review: When this TV stick arrived I carefully followed the setup directions by using all the provided items. I connected the USB cable to the TV stick and the other end of the cable to the power adapter which I then plugged into an outlet. Next I plugged the stick into the HDMI port on my TV. I turned on the TV and selected the HDMI port where I had plugged in the stick. I then installed the two AAA batteries into the remote and sat back to watch a movie. Bah, humbug! No movie could be watched because the stick could not find the network. I tried everything I could think of but no connection ever could be made.I was out of ideas and decided to pack the stick and other contents back up until I decided whether to return the stick or just eat the loss. When I opened the box to replace the items I noticed that the last item, the HDMI extender cable was still curled up in the box. Just for the heck of it I decided that since I tried everything else why not install this extender cable even if I could think of no reason why this would have any bearing on the problem. I pulled the stick out of the HDMI port and connected it to the extender cable.  I  plugged the other end of the extender cable into the HDMI port from which I had just removed the stick. Incredibly, the stick was now connected to the network. I clicked on a movie and while the movie was playing I did some settings searches and found the way to turn on the CC.This morning I decided to see if the movie connection was just a fluke so I turned on the TV, pushed a button on the stick, picked a movie and voila! everything worked like a charm including the CC. All's well that ends well.
